tags.tag: Needed for backwards compatibility with old Java API
New features for first camera 2 release (API1)
Entry is only used by camera device HAL 2.x
Entry is required for full hardware level devices, and optional for other hardware levels

entry.name: analysisMode

enum.value: OFF (default) Do not include AIQ extended results in capture result metadata
ON Include AIQ extended result in capture result metadata

entry.description: Whether the extended AIQ analysis results are provided for each capture request.
entry.details:
This is the list of extra tags that will be present in the result:
* multiframeHint * sceneDected * hdr.preferedExposures

entry.name: colorEffect
entry.description: This reports the recommended color effects the user should select for optimal quality.
entry.details: To be added...

entry.name: multiFrameHint

enum.value: NONE (default) No multiframe processing is required
ULL Capture would benefit of using Ultra Low Light post processing
HDR Capture would benefit of using High Dynamic Range post processing

entry.description: This reports the recommendation from the Intel 3A to use one of the multi-frame postprocessing algotithms.
entry.details: To be added...

entry.name: sceneDetected
entry.description: This reports the recommended scene mode the user should select for optimal quality.
entry.details: This is the ouput of the Intel Discrete Scene Detection algorithm.

entry.name: smileDetectMode

enum.value: OFF Do not include smile detection statistics in capture results
ON Return smile status and score values

entry.description: Control of Smile detection.
entry.details: When ON, com.intel.faceEngine.smileDetectStatus (dynamic) and com.intel.faceEngine.smileDetectScores (dynamic) outputs are valid.

entry.name: blinkDetectMode

enum.value: OFF Do not include blink detection statistics in capture results
ON Return blink status and score values

entry.description: Control of Blink detection.
entry.details: When ON, com.intel.faceEngine.blinkDetectStatus (dynamic) and com.intel.faceEngine.blinkDetectScores (dynamic) outputs are valid.

entry.name: faceRecognizeMode

enum.value: OFF Do not include face recognition statistics in capture results
ON Return person id and person similarity

entry.description: Control of Face recognition.
entry.details: When ON, com.intel.faceEngine.faceRecognizePersonIds (dynamic) and com.intel.faceEngine.faceRecognizePersonSimilarities (dynamic) outputs are valid.

entry.name: smileDetectStatus
entry.description: This metadata tag will provide a list of smile status of faces. The order of this list is always aligned with the IDs produced by the android-defined metadata tagin. android.statistics.faceIds.
entry.details: True means smiling face. False means non-smiling face

entry.name: smileDetectScores
entry.description: This metadata tag will provide an list of smile confidence scores. The scores are confidence level that the face is smiling.
entry.details: 0 means itâ€™s no smile at all. 100 means fully smiling face.

entry.name: blinkDetectStatus
entry.description: This metadata tag will provide a list of blink status of faces. The order of this list is always aligned with the IDs produced by the android-defined metadata tagin. android.statistics.faceIds.
entry.details: True means closed eye. False means open eye. The meaning of array should be like: "0th face lefe eye|0th face right eye|1th face left eye|1th face right eye|2th face left eye|2th face right eye"

entry.name: blinkDetectScores
entry.description: This metadata tag will provide an list of blink confidence scores. The scores are confidence level that the face is blinking.
entry.details: 0 means closed eye. 100 means wide-open eye.

entry.name: faceRecognizePersonIds
entry.description: This metadata tag will provide a list of person Ids from face recognition. Each person is identified as unique positive integer. This is different from android.statistics.faceIds, which is unique among the tracking session
entry.details: -10000 means unkown face. Positive integer means each person id. 0 is illegal.

entry.name: faceRecognizePersonSimilarities
entry.description: This metadata tag will provide a list of person similarities from face recognition. It is the biggest one of the estimated levels between the input face and the faces in databases. It is good to be tread as a kind of score.
entry.details: 0 is not likely the person 100 is quite sure of the person

entry.name: faceDetectRipAngles
entry.type_notes: (-180~180) x n, where n is number of faces
entry.description: This metadata tag will provide an list of RIP (Rotation In-Plane) angles from face detection. Represented in degree. Also known as 'rolling'.
entry.details: The angle is represented as degree. The upright face is 0 degree, clock wise is positive, CC wise is negatives.

entry.name: faceDetectRopAngles
entry.type_notes: (-1, 0, 1) x n, where n is number of faces
entry.description: This metadata tag will provide an list of ROP (Rotation out-of-plane) angles from face detection. Represented in degree. Also known as 'yawing'. Piching is not supported
entry.details: The frontal face is 0, left profile face is -1, right profile face is 1.

entry.name: availableSmileDetect
entry.description: List of enums from com.intel.faceEngine.smileDetectMode
entry.details:
NO is always supported.
YES means the device supports com.intel.faceEngine.smileDetectStatus and com.intel.faceEngine.smileDetectScores outputs.

entry.name: availableBlinkDetect
entry.description: List of enums from com.intel.faceEngine.blinkDetectMode
entry.details:
NO is always supported.
YES means the device supports com.intel.faceEngine.blinkDetectStatus and com.intel.faceEngine.blinkDetectScores outputs.

entry.name: availableFaceRecognize
entry.description: List of enums from com.intel.faceEngine.faceRecognizeMode
entry.details:
NO is always supported.
Yes means the device supports com.intel.faceEngine.faceRecognizePersonIds and com.intel.faceEngine.faceRecognizePersonSimilarities outputs.

entry.name: availableObjectTrack
entry.description: List of enums from com.intel.faceEngineObjectTracking.mode
entry.details:
NO is always supported.
Yes means the device supports com.intel.faceEngine.objectTrackingBoundingRectangles, com.intel.faceEngine.objectTrackingTrackingIds and com.intel.faceEngine.objectTrackingScores outputs.

entry.name: availablePanorama
entry.description: List of enums from com.intel.faceEngine.panoramaMode
entry.details:
NO is always supported.
Yes means the device supports (TO BE DEFINED)
